title: EIM24725 - Car benefit calculation Step 5, appropriate percentage, 2006/07 to 2010/11:table summarising adjustments to appropriate percentage for different fuels

details.body:
This page relates to step 5 of the method statement in Section 121(1) ITEPA 2003, see [EIM24015](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24015.htm). The ready reckoner at [EIM24700](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24700.htm) gives the appropriate percentage for cars powered by petrol (type P). This table brings together all adjustments to the appropriate percentage arising from the use of other fuels, including those for diesel cars, from 2006/07 to 2010/11. For other years, see below. Fuller information is available at the page references given.
**Type of fuel** **Code** **Page** **Standard adjustment** **See note** **Other adjustments**
Petrol [EIM24800](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24800.htm) none none
Diesel (up to Euro III) [EIM24805](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24805.htm) supplement: 3% none
Diesel (Euro IV) first registered on or before 31 December 2005 [EIM24810](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24810.htm) cancel type D supplement, above none
Diesel (Euro IV or 5) first registered on or after 1 January 2006 [EIM24810](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24810.htm) supplement: 3% (as type D) none
Electric only [EIM24815](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24815.htm) reduction: 6% none
Petrol/electric hybrid [EIM24820](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24820.htm) reduction: 3% none
Gas only [EIM24830](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24830.htm) reduction: 2% none
Bi-fuel with CO2 emissions figure for gas [EIM24830](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24830.htm) reduction: 2% 2, 3 use lowest CO2 figure
Bi-fuel conversion, or other bi-fuel not within type B [EIM24835](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24835.htm) none none
Car manufactured to be capable of running on E85 fuel [EIM24840](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24840.htm) reduction: 2% (from 2008/09 only) none
### Notes
Subject to the overall maximum appropriate percentage of 35%.
Bi-fuel car meeting the conditions to be a type B car at [EIM24825](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24825.htm).
These adjustments do not apply to qualifying low emissions cars (QUALECs, see [EIM24605](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24605.htm)), nor to any diesel/electric hybrid cars that may become available. QUALECs are only defined for years from 2008/09 onwards.
Appropriate percentage for type E cars is 0% in 2010/11
Supplements and reductions only apply to cars first registered on or after 1 January 1998. They apply to all such cars, whether or not they have an approved CO2 emissions figure. ### Summary of the changes to the 2005/06 rules The changes are: * types B and H: standard reduction increased by 1% each (to 2% and 3% respectively) but the extra adjustment formerly available for very low CO2 emission cars no longer applies * type C: former reduction no longer applies * type L: supplement for type D cars also applies to type L cars first registered on or after 1 January 2006 (those registered before 1 January 2006 are unaffected). Unless the car falls into one of the categories for which adjustments are required, it is type P. ### Further changes from 2008/09 The changes are: * introduction of QUALECs, to which adjustments for diesel cars apply but alternative fuel reductions do not (see [EIM24605](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24605.htm)) * introduction of reduction for Type G cars (see above and [EIM24840](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24840.htm)). ### Adjustments in other years For adjustments for other years, see * [EIM24720](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24720.htm) for years from 2002/03 to 2005/06, and * [EIM24730](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM24730.htm) for years from 2011/12.
